title: Sir Cliff Richard at 75: Pictures spanning his incredible 57 years in showbusiness
text:
Sir Cliff Richard at 75: Pictures spanning his incredible 57 years in showbusiness Sir Cliff Richard at 75: Pictures spanning his incredible 57 years in showbusiness 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
As Sir Cliff Richard hits a milestone birthday, see how the Peter Pan of Pop has changed over the years. 1963 (PA) 
Born Harry Webb in Lucknow, India, in 1940, Sir Cliff spent the first eight years of his life in what was then a British colony before his family moved back to England. 1964 (AP/PA) Cliff is pictured wtih Liza Minnelli, daughter of actress Judy Garland. By this point, he had become a chart-topper and a film star. 1964 (PA) 
The Queen meets Cliff Richard and The Shadows at the London Palladium before the Royal Variety Show. 1968 (PA) The late Cilla Black counts votes with Cliff for Britain’s Song For Europe. The pair were good friends. At her funeral, Sir Cliff paid tribute with a song. 1973 (PA) 
The BBC cashed in on Cliff’s popularity with a variety show called It’s Cliff Richard from 1970-1974. 1982 (PA) 
By the early ’80s, Sir Cliff was being name-checked by the late Rik Mayall in anarchic comedy The Young Ones. He even collaborated with the stars of the BBC Two show on a Comic Relief version of Living Doll in 1986. 1991 (Martin Keene/PA) 
The late Diana, Princess of Wales is pictured meeting Cliff Richard at London’s Royal School of Music. Promoted stories 1995 (John Stillwell/PA) Sir Cliff Richard with his three sisters (left to right) Donna Gordon, Joan Pilgrim and Jacqui Harrison at Buckingham Palace after he received his knighthood from The Queen. 1996 (Adam Butler/PA) 
Who can forget when Sir Cliff famously kept the Wimbledon Centre Court crowd entertained during a rain delay? Yes, there was a sing-along and tennis star Martina Navratilova joined in the fun. 1997 (Neil Marland/ITV). Sir Cliff outside Weatherfield’s Rovers Return with Coronation Street stars Beverley Callard (Liz McDonald) and Liz Dawn (Vera Duckworth). 2002 (Stefan Rousseau/PA) 
Rod Stewart, Ozzy Osborne, Sir Cliff and Sir Paul McCartney on stage after the second concert to commemorate the Queen’s Golden Jubilee in 2002. 2008 (Yui Mok/PA) 
Sir Cliff has sold more than 250 million units worldwide, with over 21 million singles in the UK alone, making him the third top-selling singles artist in UK chart history, behind The Beatles and second-placed Elvis Presley. 2012 
Dubbed the Peter Pan Of Pop thanks to his comparatively youthful appearance, Sir Cliff has never married or had children. 2013 (Ian West/PA) Share article 
Sir Cliff started in the rock and roll era and went on to watch Beatlemania explode, glam rock thrive, punk erupt, disco, hip hop and dance music break out. And he’s still making music today. Promoted Stories
